Entertainment.title: Wrist Check: 14 Best Watches at the 2026 BAFTA Awards
Entertainment.text: SummaryThe 2026 BAFTA Awards red carpet showcased an impressive array of 14 standout vintage and contemporary timepiecesActor Michael B Jordan leaned into the ongoing trend of men wearing vintage ladies' watches with a diamond-encrusted Vacheron ConstantinHistory-making filmmaker Ryan Coogler celebrated his Best Original Screenplay win wearing a rare meteorite dial Rolex DaytonaThe Rolex Daytona, Vacheron Constantin Vintage Prestige de la France, and Cartier Tank Basculante led an incredible showcase of the 14 best watches at the 2026 BAFTA Awards. The prestigious London red carpet delivered a masterclass in high-end horology, proving that Hollywood's elite are increasingly opting for niche heritage designs, rare materials, and stealth-wealth statements over standard modern pieces.Leading the vintage revival, Michael B. Jordan embraced the trend of men donning vintage ladies' watches, wearing a 1970s Vacheron Constantin Vintage Prestige de la France cast in 18-karat yellow gold and set with diamonds. Paul Mescal kept things understated with a 1999 Cartier Tank Basculante featuring a unique reversible rectangular case. The Cartier love continued with David Jonsson wearing a 1970s gold Vintage Vendome, Tom Blyth dripping in a large gold Santos-Dumont, and Robert Aramayo sporting a sleek steel Ballon Bleu.On the chronograph front, Leonardo DiCaprio secured a major flex with a white-gold Rolex Daytona “Le Mans.” Released to mark the centenary of the 24 Hours of Le Mans, the piece had a notoriously short 10-month production run, making it a highly coveted modern grail. Ryan Coogler also brought the heat with a beautiful Rolex Daytona featuring a rare meteorite dial, celebrating his historic Best Original Screenplay win. Meanwhile, Aaron Pierre stepped out in the latest Omega Speedmaster Moonwatch Professional, flexing a Moonshine gold case and a striking reverse panda dial with mirrored black lacquer.Avant-garde and stealth-wealth choices were out in full force. Timothée Chalamet won the style game in a rare Urban Jürgensen UJ-2, while Stormzy paired his sharp tailoring with a black ceramic Audemars Piguet Royal Oak Double Balance Wheel Openworked. Patrick Dempsey opted for a TAG Heuer Carrera Tourbillon featuring a signature bezel-free glassbox design and a smoky purple sunray dial.Rounding out the robust list, Omega Seamasters made a strong showing. Ethan Hawke added a fun spin to his black-tie attire with a steel Aqua Terra boasting a pine green dial, while Stellan Skarsgård wore a gold Seamaster Milano Cortina 2026 edition. Finally, Miles Caton swapped his usual wristwear for a sporty 40mm steel Louis Vuitton Tambour featuring an integrated bracelet and an on-trend blue dial.Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast

Entertainment.title: A New ‘Neon Genesis Evangelion’ Series Is in Development
Entertainment.text: SummaryThe Evangelion franchise announced a brand-new series during its 30th-anniversary festival in YokohamaThe project, teased as the "Next Genesis," features a high-profile creative team including Yoko Taro and Keiichi OkabeProduction will be a joint effort between Studio Khara and CloverWorksThe Neon Genesis Evangelion franchise is officially entering a new era, announcing a brand-new series at the conclusion of its "Evangelion:30+; 30th Anniversary of Evangelion" festival. The surprise reveal, accompanied by a live cello and choral performance, introduced the project as the franchise's "Next Genesis," signaling a major expansion beyond the Rebuild films.As per AnimeNewsNetwork, the upcoming series brings together a powerhouse creative team, blending Evangelion veterans with fresh voices from the gaming and anime worlds. Yoko Taro, the acclaimed creator of the NieR franchise, joins as series script supervisor and scriptwriter. He will be working alongside directors Kazuya Tsurumaki (Rebuild of Evangelion) and Tōko Yatabe (Evangelion: 3.0+1.0 assistant director). The musical score will be composed by Keiichi Okabe, known for his haunting work on NieR: Automata.Animation production will be a collaborative effort between Hideaki Anno’s Studio Khara and CloverWorks. While details on the plot remain scarce, the announcement marks the first major serialized project for the franchise since the conclusion of the Rebuild tetralogy.The 30th-anniversary event also featured the premiere of a new 13-minute short starring Asuka and a performance by original theme song artist Yoko Takahashi, celebrating the enduring legacy of the series while paving the way for its future.Watch the teaser video above and stay tuned for an official trailer and release date.Read more at Hypebeast

Entertainment.title: Winona Ryder Joins Netflix’s ‘Wednesday’ Season 3 Cast
Entertainment.text: SummaryWinona Ryder joins Netflix’s Wednesday Season 3, reuniting with Tim Burton and Jenna Ortega after Beetlejuice BeetlejuiceOther new cast members include Chris Sarandon, Noah Taylor, Oscar Morgan and Kennedy Moyer, expanding Nevermore Academy’s worldNetflix has confirmed that Winona Ryder will join the cast of Wednesday Season 3, reuniting her with longtime collaborator Tim Burton and co‑star Jenna Ortega, with whom she recently appeared in Beetlejuice Beetlejuice.In a stylish announcement trailer that mirrors the show's gothic aesthetic, Ryder was revealed to be playing a character named Tabitha, adding even more star power and intrigue to the supernatural series. Eva Green will portray Ophelia as teased at the finale of Season 2, with additional cast members including Chris Sarandon, Noah Taylor, Oscar Morgan and Kennedy Moyer, all set to bring fresh dynamics to Nevermore Academy.The third season is now officially in production, continuing the momentum from the show's record-breaking debut in 2022, which quickly became one of Netflix’s most-watched English-language series of all time. Directed by Tim Burton, the series has garnered a massive global following for its unique blend of mystery, dark humor and boarding school drama at Nevermore Academy. With the addition of Ryder - who famously collaborated with Burton on Beetlejuice and Edward Scissorhands - fans are eagerly anticipating how her character will interact with the macabre world of the Addams family when the new season eventually arrives on the platform.Read more at Hypebeast

Entertainment.title: Carhartt WIP Celebrates 15 Years of Independent Radio With Audio Archives Capsule
Entertainment.text: SummaryCarhartt WIP has announced "Audio Archives," a new project celebrating over 15 years of its influential radio platformThe expansive initiative features a massive 1,200-page publication, a graphic apparel capsule, and a collaborative Teenage Engineering radioHighlighting 17 independent radio stations worldwide, the physical collection officially launches on February 26Carhartt WIP is honoring the cultural impact of community broadcasting with the launch of its multifaceted "Audio Archives" collection. Marking over 15 years of Carhartt WIP Radio, the expansive initiative brings together 17 independent radio stations from around the world to celebrate the enduring legacy and modern evolution of independent music platforms.At the center of the project is the Audio Archives publication. Spanning over 1,200 pages, the comprehensive book features a curated selection of poster artworks and an extensive archive of Carhartt WIP Radio features dating back to the platform's 2008 inception. The massive physical release is accompanied by a special 7-inch Flexi-disk, which includes a compilation of soundbites, voiceovers, and introductions from the participating global stations.Accompanying the printed matter is a dedicated capsule collection designed for audiophiles and brand enthusiasts alike. The apparel lineup comprises two graphic print long-sleeve shirts, a cozy hooded sweatshirt, and a functional record bag. Rounding out the collaborative hardware is a limited-edition Teenage Engineering OB-4 Magic Radio, merging premium audio technology with Carhartt WIP's signature utilitarian design ethos. Following the product launch, a global program of live broadcasts and events will kick off at Berlin’s NBB Gallery before traveling worldwide.The Carhartt WIP "Audio Archives" collection and publication drop on February 26 via Carhartt WIP.Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast

Entertainment.title: The Nike Air Flightposite 3 Is Rumored To Return In 2027
Entertainment.text: SummaryNike is reportedly preparing to bring back the Air Flightposite 3 for the first time since its original 2001 debutThe futuristic basketball sneaker is recognized for its molded Foamposite upper and distinctive holographic side panelsSneaker insiders suggest the highly anticipated retro release will arrive during the Spring 2027 seasonNike is rumored to revisit its early-2000s performance archive with the return of the Nike Air Flightposite 3. Initially introduced in 2001 as part of the brand's Alpha Project era, the Eric Avar-designed model has never received a proper retro, making its expected comeback a significant moment for basketball footwear enthusiasts.According to sneaker insiders Sneaker Files, the silhouette is slated to make its return in Spring 2027. While it was never tied to a single signature athlete, the bold design was frequently spotted on NBA courts during its initial run. The sneaker's striking visual identity is anchored by a molded Foamposite upper and unique holographic "eye-like" side panels.Performance elements are expected to remain faithful to the original construction, featuring forefoot and ankle straps, a Dynamic-fit sleeve, and breathable mesh sections. Underfoot, the model relies on Zoom Air cushioning and a carbon fiber shank for maximum stability. Reports suggest that three colorways are currently planned for the retro release, though exact palettes remain unconfirmed.The Nike Air Flightposite 3 is rumored to drop in Spring 2027.Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast

Entertainment.title: Burberry FW26 Pulses to The Beat of London After Dark
Entertainment.text: British designer Daniel Lee closed London Fashion Week with a sweeping tribute to the city he calls home. For Fall/Winter 2026, Burberry staged its show inside a former Victorian fish market along the banks of the River Thames, drawing a crowd that included Stormzy and Barry Keoghan.In a theatrical nod to the capital’s famously unpredictable weather, guests stepped carefully over puddles en route to their seats — an immersive detail that set the tone for a collection rooted in London’s rhythms. Celebrating 170 years of Burberry, Lee sent the house’s iconic Check on a nocturnal journey from Hackney to Mayfair, mapping the city’s layered identities after dark. “We all walk the same roads. We’re all lit by the same streetlamps. We all feel the same buzz of the city at night,” Lee noted in the show notes. A ruffled reinterpretation of Burberry’s signature trench coat opened the runway in pale grey, soon followed by midnight-blue versions distorted in scale — some exaggerated, others sharply cropped. Leather boiler suits, quilted moto jackets, and olive-green tuxedos dissolved into the dimly lit set, while plush fur-trimmed coats and rich burgundy bombers brought depth and drama presented by Rosie Huntington-Whiteley and Romeo Beckham. Sleek yet subversive, refined yet rebellious, Burberry FW26 captured London in all its contrasts. Lee observes the capital through rain-slicked streets, hushed conversations, and electric possibility shimmering beneath the stars.Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast

Entertainment.title: Mayweather vs. Pacquiao Rematch Officially Set for September at the Sphere
Entertainment.text: SummaryFloyd Mayweather Jr. and Manny Pacquiao are set for a rematch on September 19, streaming live globally on NetflixThe event marks the first-ever professional boxing match to be held at the Sphere in Las VegasBoth fighters express unfinished business, with Pacquiao aiming to hand Mayweather his first professional lossThe "Fight of the Century" is getting a sequel. Netflix has officially announced that Floyd Mayweather Jr. and Manny Pacquiao will step back into the ring for a highly anticipated rematch on September 19. This landmark event not only reignites one of the sport's most storied rivalries but also breaks new ground as the first boxing match to take place at the immersive Sphere in Las Vegas. The announcement comes over a decade after their initial 2015 clash, which shattered pay-per-view records and saw Mayweather claim a unanimous decision victory. Now, with both legends in their late 40s (Mayweather will be 49 and Pacquiao 47), the stakes are personal.Pacquiao has publicly stated his desire to be the one to blemish Mayweather's perfect 50-0 record, dedicating the fight to his fans and country. “It’s been 11 years since Floyd and I gave the world what is still the biggest fight in boxing history,” Pacquiao stated. “The fans have waited long enough. They deserve this rematch, which will be even bigger since it will be streamed live globally on Netflix. I want Floyd to be forever haunted by the one loss on his professional record and always remember who gave it to him. As always, I dedicate this fight to my fellow Filipinos around the world, and to bring glory to the Philippines.”Mayweather, coming out of retirement for the bout, remains confident, asserting that the result will mirror their first encounter. “I already fought and beat Manny once,” he said. “This time will be the same result.”Netflix’s entry into live combat sports continues to expand with this marquee event. “Earlier in my career, I spent weeks in Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao’s training camps in Las Vegas and the Philippines,” shared Gabe Spitzer, Vice President of Sports at Netflix. “It was undeniable that they were the two hardest workers in boxing, and their wins and accolades were a product of that. Bringing this rematch to Netflix is a massive ‘full circle’ moment. We’re thrilled to combine their storied rivalry with the immersive technology of Sphere to deliver a landmark sporting event to our members worldwide.”While ticket details are still forthcoming, the fight will be available to all Netflix subscribers without a separate pay-per-view fee, potentially setting a new standard for accessibility in major boxing events.The Floyd Mayweather Jr. vs. Manny Pacquiao rematch streams live September 19, exclusively on Netflix.Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast

Entertainment.title: Pharrell Williams Presents the Louis Vuitton Formal Fall/Winter 2026 Collection
Entertainment.text: SummaryLouis Vuitton has officially unveiled its comprehensive Formal Menswear collection for the Fall/Winter 2026 seasonSpearheaded by Men's Creative Director Pharrell Williams the range is divided into Timeless Business, Modern Tailoring, and Evening categoriesThe extensive ready-to-wear lineup is accompanied by revamped leather goods and a versatile selection of premium footwearLouis Vuitton and Men's Creative Director Pharrell Williams have officially introduced the Formal Fall/Winter 2026 collection. The meticulously designed menswear capsule is crafted to exceed the dress codes of any seasonal celebration, seamlessly transitioning from daytime business meetings to elegant black-tie events.The ready-to-wear apparel is organized into three distinct categories. The Timeless Business tier imbues superfine materials with micro-patterning, featuring pinstripes of minuscule LV Flowers, tiny Damier Seeds jacquard, and tone-on-tone Monogram prints. Meanwhile, Modern Tailoring takes a more eclectic approach by crosshatching workwear, trucker staples, and uniform aesthetics. Standouts include Gaston, Napolitana, and Pont Neuf suiting layered with reversible wool-cashmere gilets, alongside wool twill carpenter-style suits featuring riveted pocket fronts and embossed jean buttons. For upscale functions, the Evening collection inflects classic tuxedo silhouettes with the fluid grace of open-collar dressing gowns, highlighted by a versatile cheetah-print silk pajama-style set and a collarless jacket embellished with luminous pinstripes.Footwear options are equally expansive, introducing the new sacchetto-constructed LV Gent Loafer in soft calf or suede for an ultra-supple, glove-like fit. Classic silhouettes like the Varenne Richelieu, Sorbonne Loafer, and LV Flex Derby arrive in premium calf leather, while the Evening-exclusive LV Premiere Oxford and Slipper shine in patent finishes. The collection is rounded out by the revamped LV Aerogram line of travel bags and wallets, alongside enameled silver Monogram Flower cufflinks, silk ties, and premium belts crafted from patinated calf, ostrich, and rare crocodile leathers.The Louis Vuitton Formal Fall/Winter 2026 collection is now available via Louis Vuitton.Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast

Art & Culture.title: "Fashion is Art" Is the Dress Code of the 2026 Met Gala
Art & Culture.text: SummaryVogue and The Metropolitan Museum of Art have confirmed "Fashion is Art" as the dress code for the 2026 Met GalaThe code supports the spring exhibition Costume Art, which will inaugurate the museum’s new Condé Nast GalleriesA power-house roster of co-chairs including Beyoncé, Nicole Kidman, and Venus Williams will lead the May 4th eventVogue has officially set the stage for the fashion industry’s most anticipated evening, announcing that the 2026 Met Gala will observe the dress code "Fashion is Art." This year's directive invites attendees to transcend traditional red carpet styling, encouraging looks that embody the conceptual and technical mastery usually reserved for gallery walls.The dress code serves as a direct extension of the Costume Institute’s spring 2026 exhibition, titled "Costume Art." Curated to dismantle the historical hierarchy between fine art and fashion, the retrospective will feature nearly 400 objects spanning five millennia. These pieces will be displayed within the museum's newly named Condé Nast Galleries, emphasizing the symbiotic relationship between the garment and the artistic canon.“What connects every curatorial department and what connects every single gallery in the museum is fashion, or the dressed body,” Andrew Bolton, the Costume Institute's curator, shared. “It’s the common thread throughout the whole museum, which is really what the initial idea for the exhibition was.”To helm the event, Vogue’s Anna Wintour has assembled a diverse group of cultural icons. Music royalty Beyoncé returns to the steps as a co-chair, joined by Academy Award winner Nicole Kidman and tennis legend Venus Williams. They will be supported by a host committee that bridges the worlds of luxury and entertainment, co-chaired by creative director Anthony Vaccarello and actress Zoë Kravitz, and includes Sabrina Carpenter, Doja Cat, Gwendoline Christie, Alex Consani, Misty Copeland, Elizabeth Debicki, Lena Dunham, Paloma Elsesser, LISA, Chloe Malle, Sam Smith, Teyana Taylor, Lauren Wasser, Anna Weyant, A’ja Wilson, Yseult, Adut Akech, Angela Bassett, Sinéad Burke, Rebecca Hall, Aimee Mullins, Tschabalala Self, Amy Sherald, and Chase Sui Wonders. Meanwhile, lead sponsors Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sánchez Bezos will serve as honorary chairs.The 2026 Met Gala will take place on May 4 at The Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City.Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast

Art & Culture.title: Tomokazu Matsuyama Lights Up Times Square With “Morning Again”
Art & Culture.text: SummaryTomokazu Matsuyama debuts “Morning Again” at Times Square Arts’ Midnight Moment, running nightly from April 1 – 30, 2026Over 90 LED screens synchronize for three minutes, replacing ads with abstract imagery of hope, rhythm, self‑expression, and transformationFor one month starting April 1, 2026, Brooklyn-based artist Tomokazu Matsuyama will take over New York’s Times Square with his latest digital public art project, "Morning Again." As part of the prestigious Midnight Moment program, the city’s largest and longest-running digital art series, Matsuyama’s work will synchronize across more than 96 massive LED screens from 41st to 49th Streets. Every night for three minutes - from 11:57 p.m. to midnight - the usual commercial advertisements will vanish, replaced by a 180-second cinematic experience that merges the city’s pulse with Matsuyama’s vibrant, cross-cultural aesthetic.Born in Gifu, Japan and seasoned by decades in the cultural melting pot of New York, Tomokazu Matsuyama is widely recognized for his ability to bridge disparate worlds. His practice often blends Edo-period iconography and traditional Japanese craft with Western Pop art, street culture, and Abstract Expressionism.“Morning Again” emphasizes four key elements - hope, rhythm, self‑expression and transformation - rather than depicting specific figures. These abstract motifs unfold as shifting shapes, glowing light and vibrant hues that mirror the city’s pulse. The work highlights how diverse cultural energies intersect and overlap, creating a shared urban identity. In a time marked by uncertainty and division, Matsuyama’s installation quietly affirms diversity and individuality while suggesting the possibility of moving forward together.In keeping with Matsuyama’s signature style, the piece intentionally avoids a fixed hierarchy of imagery, allowing histories and diverse identities to coexist within the same frame. This approach reflects his ongoing exploration of "borderless identity" and how narratives overlap in an increasingly interconnected global society.Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast

Longevity & Anti-Aging.title: Birdwatching may reshape the brain and build its buffer against ageing
Longevity & Anti-Aging.text: Expert birdwatchers have changes in their brain structure compared with novices, which probably help them better identify birds and may even protect against age-related cognitive decline

Longevity & Anti-Aging.title: Relationships Between an Aged Oral Microbiome and Harms Done by Senescent Cells
Longevity & Anti-Aging.text: The aging of the oral microbiome is relatively understudied in commparison to the present interest in the aging of the gut microbiome, but there is still a fairly sizable literature on the topic. There is clear evidence for a relationship between the oral microbiome and age-related disease, which one will largely find in the context of the potential effects of inflammatory gum disease on cardiovascular and neurodegenerative conditions, where researchers are interested in the leakage of microbes and their metabolites into the bloodstream via injured gums. The literature is not consistent when it comes to effect sizes, however; it is unclear as to how much of a problem this is. Today's open access paper presents a different focus on the oral microbiome, more akin to […]

Longevity & Anti-Aging.title: Aging B Cells are Harmful to Immune Function
Longevity & Anti-Aging.text: The immune system is full of specific examples of what is known as antagonistic pleiotropy, the evolution of systems that are beneficial in youth but become harmful in old age. B cells serve a useful but not absolutely vital role in the immune system; one can survive without B cells if necessary, at the cost of diminished immune responsiveness. Unfortunately, aging brings a growing population of dysfunctional, harmful age-associated B cells that aggravate loss of immune function and age-related disease more generally. Destruction of B cells is readily achieved in animal models, either temporarily or permanently. Temporary clearance of B cells in mice is beneficial, removing the age-associated B cells and replacing them with more functional B cells, while here researchers show that permanent life-long […]

Longevity & Anti-Aging.title: OMG as a Marker of Resiliency to Neurodegenerative Processes
Longevity & Anti-Aging.text: Researchers here provide evidence for circulating oligodendrocyte myelin glycoprotein (OMG, and the expected joking reference is made in the paper's title) to correlate with the state of neurodegeneration in the aging brain. Interestingly, further investigations indicated that OMG is actively protective, not just a marker of protection, and thus one can envisage efforts to increase its expression in the brain as a basis for future therapies to make the brain more resilient to the damage of aging. That process of development is ever a long one, of course, and it is hard to predict timelines for moving from identification of a target to a viable approach to therapy. After identifying oligodendrocyte myelin glycoprotein (OMG) as a central nervous system (CNS)-specific protein whose levels in peripheral […]

Longevity & Anti-Aging.title: Attenuating age-related decline in dendritic cell migration improves vaccine efficacy via gut-immune crosstalk.
Longevity & Anti-Aging.text:
Paper Details
                Authors: Huaxing Dai, Rong Sun, Bowen Xie, Fang Xu, Xiaoyu Yu, Chenhui Weng, Chenlu Yao, Heng Wang, Bingbing Wu, Jialu Xu, Yue Zhang, Bo Tian, Xiaolin Shi, Yumin Wu, Ye Liu, Chao Wang
                Institution: Laboratory for Biomaterial and Immunoengineering, Institute of Functional Nano & Soft Materials (FUNSOM), Soochow University, Suzhou, China.
                
                Journal: Nature aging
                
                Abstract
                Aging impairs immune function and reduces vaccine efficacy, but whether dendritic cells (DCs), which play a central role in initiating immune responses via antigen presentation, contribute to this decline remains unclear. Through single-cell RNA sequencing analysis of lymph node changes upon vaccination in young versus aged mice, here we identify defects in DC migration during aging, alongside a dysfunction-associated gene signature in migratory DCs, and implicate these defects in the diminished vaccine response observed in aging. Furthermore, we demonstrate that oral delivery of yeast-derived nanoparticles elevates expression of the chemokine receptor CCR7 in gut dendritic cells, facilitates their trafficking to lymph nodes in response to chemotactic signals after immunization, and thus enhances vaccine-induced immunity in aged animals. These findings reveal a key mechanism of immune decline in aging and offer a noninvasive strategy to improve dendritic cell function and vaccine efficacy in aging.
                
                Longevity Relevance Analysis
                The paper claims that enhancing dendritic cell migration through gut-immune crosstalk can improve vaccine efficacy in aged mice. This research addresses a mechanism of immune decline associated with aging, which is directly relevant to understanding and potentially mitigating age-related immune dysfunction.
                
                Read the full paper
